title: Does a free eBook mean the book is more than likely poorly written with lots of grammar errors? - Quora

response.answer_text: Possibly, but probably not. Especially if the book’s free on Amazon. Why? Because Amazon makes offering a book for free difficult. If the publisher has figured out the steps needed to make a book permafree, they’re probably doing it for a well-thought-through reason — ie, using it as a loss leader, away to market other books. If a publisher can operate at that level of sophistication, they hopefully realize that they need to exert at least a modicum of editorial discipline.

Usually, no. Many authors use a free ebook as a marketing tool. They offer the first book in their fiction series for free to entice readers — and then they make their money on sales of books in the rest of the series. Authors can also create Kindle promotions to give away any of their ebooks at a discount or free for a limited time. Again, this is a marketing technique to hook new readers. Most of the free ebooks I’ve read have been well-edited and professionally written. And they’ve introduced me to some wonderful new authors.
Thanks for the A2A. No. Authors often give away books for promotions. It doesn't have anything to do with content most of the time.
